intro: Senecio dindondl, commonly known as the Dindondl groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Senecio dindondl is often used in rock gardens due to its hardiness and ornamental value.
